Described Disease.Described Disease: Glioblastoma Multiforme, Colon Cancer, Lung Cancer

Material used.Description: Human cancer cell lines lacking or expressing PARK2 were used for transfection and colony formation assays.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of PARK2 with tumor-derived mutation c.124A>G resulted in decreased colony-forming activity compared to wild-type PARK2.
Expression of PARK2 with tumor-derived mutation c.823C>T resulted in decreased colony-forming activity compared to wild-type PARK2.
Expression of PARK2 with tumor-derived mutation c.1030A>G resulted in decreased colony-forming activity compared to wild-type PARK2.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were performed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 was used as a positive control for colony suppression.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-only control (pcDNA3.1) was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test and ANOVA were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Colony formation activity comparable to wild-type PARK2 transfected cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly reduced colony formation activity compared to wild-type PARK2 transfected cells (P < 0.001).

Material used.Description: T98G cells were transfected with hemagglutinin-ubiquitin (HA-Ub), vector only, wild-type PARK2, or mutant PARK2 cDNAs.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutation c.124A>G substantially decreased PARK2's E3 ligase function and ability to ubiquitinate cyclin E.
Mutation c.823C>T substantially decreased PARK2's E3 ligase function and ability to ubiquitinate cyclin E.
Mutation c.1030A>G substantially decreased PARK2's E3 ligase function and ability to ubiquitinate cyclin E.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 was used as a positive control for ubiquitination activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-only control (pcDNA3.1) was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Ubiquitination activity comparable to wild-type PARK2 transfected cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly reduced ubiquitination activity compared to wild-type PARK2 transfected cells (P < 0.05).

Material used.Description: Cells were analyzed following PARK2 knockdown for cell cycle distribution.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK2 knockdown (including mutations like c.124A>G) increased the proportion of cells in S and G2-M phases.
PARK2 knockdown (including mutations like c.823C>T) increased the proportion of cells in S and G2-M phases.
PARK2 knockdown (including mutations like c.1030A>G) increased the proportion of cells in S and G2-M phases.

Basic negative control.Description: Scrambled siRNA controls were used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell cycle distribution comparable to control cells with scrambled siRNA.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in S and G2-M phase cells compared to control cells.
